channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 1 student dead, 1 critically injured in shooting at Kentucky State University
item.description: Classes and campus activities were canceled for the rest of the week after a shooting that police said left one student dead and another in critical condition. Police said a suspect who is not a KSU student was in custody.
item.content:encoded:
Classes and campus activities were canceled for the rest of the week after a shooting that police said left one student dead and another in critical condition. Police said a suspect who is not a KSU student was in custody.

(Image credit: Hannah Brown/The State Journal)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Farmers' reactions are mixed after Trump announces one-time relief payments
item.description: American farmers have taken a huge financial hit from President Trump's tariffs and trade policies, and are anxiously waiting for the federal financial assistance he announced Monday.
item.content:encoded: American farmers have taken a huge financial hit from President Trump's tariffs and trade policies, and are anxiously waiting for the federal financial assistance he announced Monday.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Affordable housing partnership teaches high school students building trades
item.description: Affordable housing and a shortage of skilled trades workers are both pressing issues in the U.S. A Colorado city is partnering with a local school district and Habitat for Humanity to teach kids trades by building homes working people can afford.
item.content:encoded: Affordable housing and a shortage of skilled trades workers are both pressing issues in the U.S. A Colorado city is partnering with a local school district and Habitat for Humanity to teach kids trades by building homes working people can afford.
item.dc:creator: Sam Fuqua

item.title: Millions of borrowers in Biden's SAVE plan would start paying under new settlement
item.description: Legal challenges put SAVE borrowers in limbo for months, a time during which they were not required to make payments on their loans. That would change if the proposed settlement is approved.
item.content:encoded: Legal challenges put SAVE borrowers in limbo for months, a time during which they were not required to make payments on their loans. That would change if the proposed settlement is approved.
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Believe it or not, this book makes taxes fascinating
item.description: The Price of Democracy tells the history of taxation from colonization to the present day. It's essential reading for anyone who cares about preserving democracy.
item.content:encoded: The Price of Democracy tells the history of taxation from colonization to the present day. It's essential reading for anyone who cares about preserving democracy.
item.dc:creator: Ericka Taylor

item.title: Black bear populations are bouncing back. Here's how these Texas towns are coping
item.description: Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.
item.content:encoded:
Historically, Black bears were the biggest predator to travel the Big Bend area of Texas. But overhunting and habitat loss led to their decline.

(Image credit: Carlos Morales)
item.dc:creator: Carlos Morales

item.title: A 101-year-old runs the largest nutcracker museum in the U.S. Here's a look inside
item.description: Arlene Wagner has been collecting nutcrackers for nearly 50 years. Now, she's got one of the largest collections in the world, housed at the Leavenworth Nutcracker Museum in Washington.
item.content:encoded:
Arlene Wagner has been collecting nutcrackers for nearly 50 years. Now, she's got one of the largest collections in the world, housed at the Leavenworth Nutcracker Museum in Washington.

(Image credit: Chona Kasinger for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Romo

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump expected to address affordability at Pennsylvania rally, SCOTUS seems poised to side with Trump in FTC firing, Indiana lawmakers expected to vote on controversial redistricting plan.
item.content:encoded: President Trump expected to address affordability at Pennsylvania rally, SCOTUS seems poised to side with Trump in FTC firing, Indiana lawmakers expected to vote on controversial redistricting plan.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Sen. Van Hollen urges Democrats to stand for something â€” not just be anti-Trump
item.description: Democrats have become the party of the status quo, says Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland. He's urging members of his party to craft sharper election messages and back new voices in the party.
item.content:encoded:
Democrats have become the party of the status quo, says Sen. Chris Van Hollen of Maryland. He's urging members of his party to craft sharper election messages and back new voices in the party.

(Image credit: Manuel Balce Ceneta)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Some farmers says Trump's proposed bailout won't help with rising health care costs
item.description: President Trump has proposed a $12 billion plan to help farmers across the country, but some say they also need help with the rising health insurance costs they may face if certain subsidies expire.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has proposed a $12 billion plan to help farmers across the country, but some say they also need help with the rising health insurance costs they may face if certain subsidies expire.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hawkins
